page.title: 02HISTORY: CROPWELL BUTLER ETC
page.content: {CROPWELL BUTLER, TITHBY & WIVERTON.} These three English/Scandinavian villages were settled before 1086 (Domesday Book). Cropwell Butler derives its name from the adjacent Hoe Hill, Crophille-kropper (hump), Butler the Lordship of the Butlers of Warrin- gton. Tithby, Tidhe's village, and Wiverton, Wivre tun, O/E tun-town. Wiverton Hall (listed), built in the 1840's incorporating the Gate House of the original Hall demolished in the 1640's, reverted to the Crown in 1938. It was occupied by the Army in 1939-45 and sold by the Commissioners of Crown Lands in 1947 for Â£2000, sold again in 1973 for Â£80,000 and since then has been allowed to get into a dilapidated state. The land in front of the Hall, consisting of a gun emplacement & part of the original roadway to the Hall, is Scheduled as an Ancient Monument.
